comments:
Open a new WST Examples project.
Modify Catalogue.xsd by deleting most of it, so that you are just left with the following. Do this by clicking on line 12, pressing ctrl-shift End, pressing up arrow once and pressing delete

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        targetNamespace="http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/Catalogue" xmlns:c="http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/Catalogue">

        <complexType name="PublicationType">
                <sequence>
                        <element name="title" type="string"></element>
                        <element name="author" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></element>
                        <element name="date" type="gYear"></element>
                </sequence>
        </complexType>

</schema>

Right click Catalogue.xml
Choose Validate, I got the following exception, but it doesn't seem to be always repeatable.

This looks like a problem with the editor, not the validator. I'm reassigning to SSE.

The NPE you get looks just like the one reported in bug 141013.  I am confused though because from the description, it sounds like you are not actually attempting to open Catalogue.xml, so I don't know why the stack trace makes it look like you are.

Can you explain how you can tell from the stacktrace? Yesterday I got about 3 of these exceptions, but each time cannot repeat, so am never entirely sure of the sequence of events, so understanding the stack trace will probably help me verify what I was doing.

If you start from the bottom of the stacktrace, you can see the workbench is running until it gets an open event:
org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy$1.handleEvent(OpenStrategy.java:283)

Then this trickles up, package explorer handing the open event: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.PackageExplorerActionGroup.handleOpen(PackageExplorerActionGroup.java:306)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.packageview.PackageExplorerPart$4.open(PackageExplorerPart.java:651)

The call is made for the workbench to open the editor:
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2478)
        at org.eclipse.ui.ide.IDE.openEditor(IDE.java:388)
        at org.eclipse.ui.ide.IDE.openEditor(IDE.java:350)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.openInEditor(EditorUtility.java:275)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.EditorUtility.openInEditor(EditorUtility.java:139)

And the top few lines are editor setup.  Looking through, there is no mention of validate/validation.  So that's why it looks like this is a null pointer exception from opening the editor, and that's why this bug looks like a dupe of bug 141013.  If you agree, please mark this bug as a duplicate, and if you can come up with a reproducible scenario, that would be extremely helpful (so far it sounds like no one has)  Thanks.

I got an identical exception. This time I'm 100% sure I followed these steps:

closed static_data.xml
opened static_data.xml by double clicking on static_data.xml
exception gets thrown

Okay, since you are getting this exception when closing/opening the xml editor (and nothing to do with validation), I'm going to resolve this as a duplicate of bug 141013.

After I resolve this bug, could you please go to bug 141013 and state what how you are opening the editor?  Double clicking in the navigator?  Project explorer?  Which perspective?  Thanks.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 141013 ***
Closing as resolved since 1.5.1.  If this bug should not be closed, please reopen.
